title: Practical Advice and up-to-date Information on Agriculture Zones | Modern Farming | VU

tasks.task: Preparing and driving a combine harvester**
subtasks: Walking to reach the combine harvester
Mounting and dismounting the combine harvester
Operating the combine harvester controls to start the machine
Adjusting the combine harvester settings for optimal grain harvesting
Navigating the combine harvester through the crop fields
Monitoring grain collection and adjusting harvesting parameters as needed
Stopping the combine harvester at appropriate times, such as during crop height changes

tasks.task: Loading grain onto a truck**
subtasks: Walking or driving to the grain pile to begin loading
Using a shovel, pitchfork, or loader bucket to transfer grain into the truck bed
Refining the grain amounts, ensuring no overloading
Scanning the truck bed for any loose grain and collecting it
Using the truck’s lift mechanism to hoist the grain into the enclosed compartment
Ensuring the truck is completely loaded and secure

tasks.task: Driving a truck to transport grain**
subtasks: Walking to the truck and entering the driver's seat
Checking the truck’s condition (afia, fuel, etc.)
Starting the truck engine and conducting a safety check
Approaching the grain storage area (e.g., silo, bulk tank) to unload
Navigating to the specified unloading bay or pad
Implementing safety procedures before unloading (e.g., disconnecting hazards)
Using the truck’s unloading mechanism (e.g., tarp removal, auger operation)
Monitoring the unloading process for any issues and troubleshooting as needed
Ensuring the grain is unloaded safely and completely
Returning the truck to its original position or designated area

tasks.task: Cleaning and organizing the grain storage area**
subtasks: Sweeping or vacuuming the floor of the storage area
Removing any debris or old grain residue
Cleaning the silo hatches, walls, and ground level
Inspecting storage bins for damage or necessary repairs
Replenishing necessary equipment (sweeping tools, protective gear)
Organizing the loading and unloading zones for efficiency
Preparing any necessary drainage or covering for the storage area

tasks.task: Operating a storage trailer**
subtasks: Walking to the trailer and approaching it
Opening the trailer doors or bay gates
Ensuring the trailer is properly positioned for grain unloading
Using an auger or similar device to load grain into the trailer
Closing and securing the trailer doors or gates once loading is complete

tasks.task: Fixing a broken knife on a combine harvester**
subtasks: Walking to the combine harvester to inspect the issue
Identifying the specific broken knife component
Removing the faulty knife tool from the combine’s header
Replacing the broken knife with a spare tool
Securing the new knife in place and ensuring it aligns with the harvesting mechanism

tasks.task: Weighing grain into a hopper**
subtasks: Walking to the hopper designated for the grain
Positioning a container on the hopper’s scale system
Activating the scale to measure the grain’s weight
Recording the weight to track harvest progress or volume

tasks.task: Ensuring proper grain flow through the combine**
subtasks: Walking through the combine’s grain system to monitor for blockages
Clearing any clogs in the combine’s grain augers or chutes
Checking the combine’s grain auger settings and transporting it to desired bins

tasks.task: Directing equipment movement in a field**
subtasks: Observing equipment movements from a central point or command center (not directly physical)
Walking to the fields to assess equipment position and planned paths

Using hand signals, flags, or verbal commands (though the transcript refers to directing equipment, but there isn't explicit mention of physical actions; if assuming that directing includes actions like ensuring path clearance, etc., then:
Clearing paths or obstacles in the equipment's movement area
Walking alongside equipment to communicate with the operator (though communication may not be physical, if the director must physically move to check, then:
Walking to the equipment to verify alignment, position, and safety
Bracing equipment as needed (if the equipment may need support, but likely dependent on the context; this is speculative)
Walking through the field to direct the movement of multiple pieces of equipment (combines, trucks) from field entry to exit points
Maintaining a safe distance from moving equipment while directing
Ensuring all equipment follows the planned path through the field to avoid collisions or overlaps
Checking for crop stubble or barriers that might impede equipment movement and directing removal if possible (excluding the specific action though)
Adjusting the order of equipment entering and exiting the field as necessary for efficiency

tasks.task: Operating a forklift**
subtasks: Walking to the forklift and approaching it
Checking the forklift for any issues (brakes, steering) before operation
Securing the forklift seatbelt when operating
Maneuvering the forklift to the grain pile or storage area
Carefully lifting and stacking grain bales or bags using the forks
Working at heights to reach upper levels of the stack, which might require balancing and maintaining stability
Inspecting the lifted items for stability before transportation
Navigating the forklift around other equipment and personnel for safe operation
Returning the forklift to its storage area or the warehouse once finished

tasks.task: Driving a quad bike to transport grain samples**
subtasks: Walking to the quad bike and starting it
Making necessary adjustments (height, mirrors) for comfortable operation
Navigating to the storage area or sample collection points (e.g., different fields or silos)
Stopping the quad bike to collect grain samples from bins or portable devices
Collecting clean samples to avoid contaminants
Storing the collected samples safely on the bike until they can be analyzed
Adhering to safety protocols when handling grain samples (such as wearing protective gear if necessary)
Returning to the primary location to deliver the samples for analysis
Submitting or logging the samples for testing

tasks.task: Conducting equipment inspections**
subtasks: Walking around the combine harvester to check for any damages or malfunctions
Inspecting the combine’s tires, hydraulic systems, and other critical components
Performing safety checks, such as checking PTO (power take-off) safety devices
Evaluating the condition of attached implements like the header and knives
Noting any issues and scheduling repairs or maintenance if needed

tasks.task: Planting a tree**
subtasks: Walking to the designated planting location
Digging a hole approximately the same depth as the root ball or container
Positioning the tree into the hole
Backfilling the hole with soil, tamping it down to remove air pockets
Ensuring the tree is straight and adequately placed
Watering the newly planted tree to settle the soil and hydrate it

tasks.task: Administering pesticide to crops using a sprayer**
subtasks: Walking to the pesticide sprayer and connecting it to a water source
Calibrating the sprayer’s settings for the target crops and pest
Loading the sprayer with the correct pesticide solution
Driving the sprayer through the fields, maintaining proper speed and coverage
Monitoring sprayer performance for even distribution and refill as needed
Taking precautions to avoid overspraying and drift
Disposing of or properly storing remaining pesticide materials

tasks.task: Repairing a broken axle on a combine harvester**
subtasks: Walking around the combine harvester to locate the broken axle
Removing the damaged axle component
Preparing a replacement axle, ensuring compatibility
Aligning the new axle and attaching it securely, using appropriate tools

tasks.task: Repairing a broken cutter bar on a combine harvester**
subtasks: Walking to the combine harvester to inspect the broken cutter bar
Removing the faulty cutter bar component
Preparing a replacement cutter bar, which may involve measuring and fitting
Replacing the cutter bar with the new or repaired unit, ensuring it’s correctly installed

tasks.task: Transferring grain from a trailer to a storage bin using an auger**
subtasks: Walking to the trailer and checking for any issues (hoses, spouts)
Activating the auger to start grain flow into the bin
Monitoring the auger operation for any jams or inefficiencies
Adjusting the auger speed or direction if necessary to prevent overload
Ensuring the grain is transferred safely and minimizing spillage or damage
Stopping the auger and disconnecting when transfer is complete

tasks.task: Using cranes to lift grain into silos**
subtasks: Walking to the crane and ascending into the operator's seat
Positioning the crane arm over the silo opening
Lowering the silo filling bag or bin into the silo
Monitoring grain levels to prevent overfilling and ensuring smooth descent
Detaching the filled bag or bin once the silo is filled to capacity
Stopping the operation and lowering the crane arm back to its original position

tasks.task: Operating a starve auger to prevent overloading**
subtasks: Walking to the auger system and ensuring it's connected to the grain source
Adjusting the auger speed to match the grain flow from the combine
Inspecting the auger for blockages or damages during operation
Stopping the auger if a blockage is detected and clearing it before resuming
Monitoring the grain volume in the collection bin to prevent overloading

tasks.task: Ensuring proper functioning of field gates**
subtasks: Walking to the field’s perimeter to inspect the gate mechanisms
Checking for any rust, wear, or broken parts in the hinges or bolts
Lubricating the moving parts to ensure smooth operation
Testing the gate’s closing and opening functions to ensure safety
Securing all gates properly to prevent uncontrolled access to the fields

tasks.task: Handling a downed combine harvester**
subtasks: Walking to the damaged combine harvester to assess the downed condition
Disconnecting the combine from the pulled implements if possible
Implementing emergency procedures if needed (activating emergency brake, turning off implements)
Evaluating the extent of damage and deciding whether to repair on-site or transport for professional repair
If on-site repair is feasible, beginning immediate necessary repairs

tasks.task: Using a stripper header on a combine harvester**
subtasks: Walking to the combine harvester and confirming the stripper header attachment is in place
Adjusting the header for the correct crop type (changes vary based on whether corn or wheat being harvested)
Engaging the stripper header to start harvesting while monitoring performance
Ensuring the grain is properly ejected from the header without issues

tasks.task: Conducting end-of-day maintenance on combine harvester**
subtasks: Walking around the combine harvester after harvest to check for any residual grain
Cleaning the machine’s exterior and vital components (engine, belts, etc.)
Checking and topping up fluids (oil, fuel, hydraulic fluid)
Lubricating joints and pivot points to prevent rust and ensure smooth operation
Inspecting and adjusting belts for correct tension
Securing any loose parts or implements
Running a basic test to verify major systems are functioning (e.g., hydraulic, electrical)
Preparing the combine for storage or next day’s operations

tasks.task: Climbing a silo to check grain levels**
subtasks: Walking to the silo’s base and using a ladder to climb to the observation deck or platform
Monitoring grain levels in the silo and checking for any signs of spoilage or pests
Recording the grain volume and reporting to the management or maintenance team
Checking for structural integrity of the silo and reporting any concerns

tasks.task: Operating a row crop planter**
MAINTASK: Preparing and driving a combine harvester
subtasks: Walking to reach the combine harvester
Mounting and dismounting the combine harvester
Operating the combine harvester controls to start the machine

Stopping the combine harvester at appropriate times, such as during crop height changes

subtasks: Driving the planter through fields
Seeding at optimal depth

Adjusting planter speed and depth control
Lifting and lowering the planter for transportplements.
